maintenanceevent.eventdescription: Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Actor, author, producer, and director. Correspondence and production material relating to Kanin's stage and film projects.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

persname.part: Kanin, Garson, 1912-1999. Diary of Anne Frank. 1955.
Kanin, Garson, 1912-1999. Hole in the head. 1956.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Garson Kanin, actor, author, producer, and director, were deposited in the Library of Congress by Kanin in 1969.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Kanin Papers were arranged and described in 1972. In 2006 the papers were rehoused and the finding aid was updated.

processinfo.head: Transfers
processinfo.p: Photographs have been transferred to the Library's Prints and Photographs Division where they are identified as part of these papers.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The Garson Kanin Papers complement the Ruth Gordon Papers and the Ruth Gordon and Garson Kanin Papers , which are also located in the Manuscript Division.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings of Garson Kanin is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Garson Kanin are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Garson Kanin Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p:
The papers of Garson Kanin (1912-1999) span the years 1941-1965 and consist of
General Correspondence and a
Production File.

The
General Correspondence features letters exchanged with the playwright, editor, and biographer Robert E. Sherwood beginning when Kanin was a private in military training in 1941 and ending with Sherwood's death in 1955. Other correspondents include Ren√© Clair, Alec Guinness, and Dorothy Massey.

The
Production File is comprised of scripts of plays and screenplays that Kanin wrote or directed including
The Amazing Adele ,
Born Yesterday ,
The Boy ,
Come On Strong ,
The Diary of Anne Frank ,
Do Re Mi , and
A Hole in the Head . The scripts are accompanied by related matter such as casting deliberations, performance evaluations, technical notes, financial records, foreign productions, stock and amateur rights, publicity, and printed matter.

arrangement.head: Organization of the Papers
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two serines:

scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received by Kanin.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.p: Article, book, film, and stage files.

arrangement.p: Arranged by type of writing or production and therein alphabetically by title.
